title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Where output is N650m, MPC is 0.4, and autonomous consumption is N80, find total savings
explanation: Consumption C = 80 + 0.4(650) = 80 + 260 = N340. Savings S = Y - C = 650 - 340 = N310. (Note: Answer key shows N340, but calculation gives N310 - may be error)

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Which of the following economic model attempts to show the relationship between saving ratio, capital-output ratio and economic growth?
explanation: Harrod-Domar: Growth rate g = s/k, where s = savings ratio and k = capital-output ratio, linking savings, capital productivity, and economic growth.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Which state has an absolute advantage in food? in clothing?
explanation: Based on typical comparative advantage problems: if Edo produces both goods with fewer resources, it has absolute advantage in both. Specific answer depends on given data.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: What is the relative cost of producing food in Edo State, in Delta State?
optionB: % unit of clothing, ½ unit of clothing
optionC: 2 unit of clothing, 4 unit of clothing
optionD: 4 unit of clothing, 2 unit of clothing
correctAnswer: 2 unit of clothing, 4 unit of clothing
explanation: Relative cost depends on production ratios. Typically: if Edo gives up 2 clothing for 1 food, Delta gives up 4 clothing for 1 food, Edo has comparative advantage in food.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Which state will export food? Clothing?
explanation: Based on comparative advantage: State with lower opportunity cost in food exports food, other exports clothing. Typically Edo exports food, Delta exports clothing.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Which of the following growth theorist emphasizes that a country will pass through five stages?
explanation: W.W. Rostow's stages of growth: traditional society, preconditions for take-off, take-off, drive to maturity, age of high mass consumption.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Which of the following is not a factor of growth process
optionA: reducing the prices of goods and services
optionB: increasing the quantity of reproductive goods
optionC: improve the quality of the people
optionD: raise the level of productive arts
correctAnswer: reducing the prices of goods and services
explanation: Growth factors: capital accumulation, technological progress, human capital improvement, institutional development. Price reduction is outcome, not driver of growth.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Which of the following is not a problem of GDP accounting
explanation: All are GDP accounting problems: leisure value excluded, non-market activities omitted, illegal activities unmeasured, plus environmental costs, income distribution, etc.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Which of the following is not one of the advantages of globalization?
optionD: increase in economic integration of nations
explanation: Globalization typically reduces communication/transport costs through technology. Advantages include market access, technology transfer, competition, and cultural exchange.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Which of the following spending is an economic waste that negatively affects development?
explanation: While culturally significant, excessive spending on ceremonies represents consumption rather than productive investment, potentially diverting resources from development.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Which of the following is not among macroeconomics markets,
explanation: Macroeconomic markets: goods/services (product), labor (factor), money (financial), foreign exchange. Estate (property) market is more microeconomic/sector-specific.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: A change in any of the components of aggregate expenditure is amplified so that the overall effect of ______ is greater than the initial amount invested
explanation: The multiplier effect amplifies initial spending changes into larger total output (income) effects through successive rounds of spending in the economy.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Your cheque is as good as money as long as ______
optionA: the Central Bank of Nigeria accepts it
optionB: you replace it with currency within a stated period of time
explanation: Money's acceptability depends on social convention and trust. Checks function as money substitutes when generally accepted in payment, backed by banking system credibility.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: A situation where investment level depends on output is under what theory
explanation: Accelerator theory: investment depends on changes in output/income (I = vΔY), not just interest rates. Higher output growth stimulates more investment to expand capacity.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Actual decisions about monetary policy are made by ______
optionA: the chairman of Nigerian Civil service Board
optionB: the President of the Federal Republic of Nigeria
optionC: the Minister of Industry, Trade and Commerce
optionD: the Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) in consultation with senior staff.
correctAnswer: the Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) in consultation with senior staff.
explanation: Central bank governors/boards typically make monetary policy decisions, often with varying degrees of government consultation, aiming for policy independence.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Along the aggregate supply curve, which range requires an increase in price and output
explanation: Intermediate range of AS curve: both prices and output increase with AD expansion. Keynesian range: output increases with little price change; Classical: only prices rise.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: An economy bought capital good worth N50m, N100m, and N150m in 2010, 2011, 2012 and 2013 respectively, where 2013 is the current year. Capital stock at the beginning of 2012 is what?
explanation: Capital stock beginning 2012 = sum of investments 2010 (N50m) + 2011 (N100m) = N150m. 2012 investment adds to ending 2012 stock.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) sales government bonds to ______ bank reserves and ______ the money supply
explanation: CBN selling bonds withdraws reserves from banking system, reducing banks' lending capacity and contracting money supply—contractionary open market operation.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Considering the following savings functions; S = -a + (1-b)Y, (1-b) is what?
explanation: S = -a + (1-b)Y, where (1-b) is marginal propensity to save (MPS). b = MPC, so 1-b = MPS, showing additional saving from additional income.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Economic development of a country entails ______ ?
explanation: Economic development includes qualitative improvements: reduced poverty, equitable distribution, human development, institutional progress—beyond mere output/income growth (economic growth).

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Excess capacity is absent in which range of the aggregate supply curve
explanation: Classical (vertical) range: economy at full capacity, no excess capacity. Keynesian (horizontal) range: significant excess capacity; intermediate range: diminishing excess capacity.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Fisher's version of the quantity theory predicts that an increase in the quantity of money will ______
explanation: Fisher equation MV = PT: with V and T constant, money supply increase directly raises price level P—quantity theory's prediction of money-price relationship.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Globalization promotes the need for ______ among countries
explanation: Globalization increases economic interdependence through trade, finance, production networks, making countries more connected and mutually dependent.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: If the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) buys securities through its open market operations, the money supply ______
optionD: increase or decrease depending on the bank rate'
explanation: CBN buying securities injects reserves into banking system, increasing banks' lending capacity and expanding money supply through deposit creation—expansionary OMO.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: In a business cycle, as real interest rate rises, it will lead to a(an)______ of the desired stock of inventory
explanation: Higher interest rates increase inventory holding costs, encouraging businesses to reduce desired inventory levels to minimize financing costs.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: In Keynesian view, when equilibrium output is above the full employment level, what policy would be use to equate them?
explanation: Inflationary gap (output > potential) requires contractionary policies (higher rates, reduced spending, higher taxes) to reduce aggregate demand to sustainable levels.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Liquidity preferences refers to ______
optionA: the choice between holding bonds and money
optionB: the choice between holding cash and keeping money in a bank account
optionC: the need to hold money to meet any unforeseen expenses
optionD: the need to hold money to make transactions
correctAnswer: the choice between holding bonds and money
explanation: Keynes' liquidity preference theory: choice between holding money (liquid but no return) vs bonds (illiquid with interest), depending on interest rates and expectations.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Monetary policy directly affects all of the following EXCPET?
explanation: Monetary policy affects money supply, credit conditions, interest rates. Budget deficit is fiscal policy domain (taxation/spending decisions by government).

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Money creation is one of the key functions of commercial banks in Nigeria, which of the following is NOT a limitation to money-creating process banks?
optionA: keeping of excess reserves by banks
optionC: commercial banks keeping of funds to meet sudden withdrawal of deposit to customers
explanation: All limit money creation: reserve requirements restrict lending; excess reserves reduce multiplier; precautionary reserves for withdrawals constrain lending capacity.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: The following are the key disadvantages of the barter system of exchange with the exception of
optionA: no standardized measure to determine commodities' value
explanation: All are barter disadvantages: no common measure of value, double coincidence of wants, indivisibility problems, difficulty storing value, lack of deferred payment standard.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: The main purpose of financial intermediation is to channel funds____ to the deficit economic
explanation: Financial intermediaries channel funds from surplus units (savers/lenders) to deficit units (borrowers/investors), facilitating efficient capital allocation.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: The period of the business cycle in which real GDP is increasing is called the____
explanation: Expansion phase: real GDP rises, employment increases, confidence improves. Peak follows expansion, then contraction/recession, then trough (lowest point).

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: The study of economics ____
optionB: is a way of analyzing decision-making processes caused by scarcity
optionC: is concerned with proving that capitalism is better than socialism
optionD: focuses on how a business should function
correctAnswer: is a way of analyzing decision-making processes caused by scarcity
explanation: Economics studies how societies allocate scarce resources among competing uses—analyzing choices, trade-offs, and decision-making under constraints.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: The transactions demand for money____
optionA: is positively related to nominal income
optionB: is negatively reducing the price level
optionC: is negatively related to nominal income
optionD: is negatively related to real GDP
correctAnswer: is positively related to nominal income
explanation: Transaction demand: money held for daily transactions increases with income level (higher income → more transactions → more money needed).

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: The under-listed are qualities of money, please identify the odd option
explanation: All are qualities of good money: homogeneity (uniformity), scarcity (limited supply to maintain value), portability (easy to carry). Other qualities include durability, divisibility, acceptability.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: The use of spending and taxing to alter macroeconomics outcomes is known as____
explanation: Fiscal policy uses government spending and taxation to influence aggregate demand, output, employment, and price levels—distinct from monetary policy (money supply/interest rates).

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Various items have served as forms of money in human history, which of the following categories DOES NOT describe forms of money?
explanation: Money evolution: commodity money (intrinsic value), fiat money (government decree), representative money (backed by commodities). 'Broader money' refers to monetary aggregates (M2, M3), not a form of money.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: What would expansionary fiscal policy do to the budget deficit?
explanation: Expansionary fiscal policy (increased spending or tax cuts) typically widens budget deficit by reducing revenue or increasing expenditure, unless offset by economic growth effects.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: When the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) lowers the reserve requirement, investors will purchase open market bonds (a)Banks must hold less money (b)people will deposit more money (c)banks will create more money (d)Most likely no effect'
explanation: Lower reserve requirements increase banks' lending capacity, enabling more deposit creation and money supply expansion through the money multiplier process.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Which of the following government policies is most likely to lead to an increase in long-run economic growth?
optionB: increasing taxes on income received from foreign investment
optionC: establishing a price control to curb inflation
optionD: increasing spending on human capital improvement
correctAnswer: increasing spending on human capital improvement
explanation: Human capital investment (education, health, skills) enhances productivity and innovation potential, driving long-term growth. Tax increases and price controls may hinder growth.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Which of the following is most likely to benefit a debtor?
explanation: Unanticipated inflation benefits debtors by eroding real value of fixed nominal debt repayments. Lenders receive less purchasing power than expected when loan was made.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Which of the following is NOT a CORE function of the Central Bank of Nigeria?
optionB: serving as banker and adviser to the government
optionC: accepting deposits of savings and current account from wealthy individuals
optionD: Provides clearing facilities for all financial institutions
correctAnswer: accepting deposits of savings and current account from wealthy individuals
explanation: Core central bank functions: currency issuance, government banker, bankers' bank, lender of last resort, monetary policy, financial system supervision. Retail deposit-taking is commercial bank function.

title: ECO 111 (2012/2013)
question: Which of the following problems is NOT one of the central concerns of macroeconomics?
explanation: Macroeconomics concerns: economic growth, business cycles, unemployment, inflation, international trade/finance. Individual product pricing is microeconomics; overall price level (inflation) is macroeconomic.
